intro: Lasiolepis bennetii, commonly known as Bennett's hairleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Lasiolepis bennetii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
